that says, "Although Simon Cowell is desperate for Cheryl Cole to join him on the judging panel, bosses just aren't convinced." The insider goes on to say that the execs all want Christina Aguilera , adding, She is a massive star globally and her voice is recognized as one of the best of all time so there really isn't any competition especially where Cheryl Cole is concerned. But a pal of Christina Aguilera 's tells GossipCop.com, there's "no truth to her becoming a judge on X Factor."

Now we have new judges in Jennifer Lopez and Steven Tyler of Aerosmith joining Jackson. No more Simon Cowell to diss country music- a fact the 62-year-old rocker Steven Tyler recently pointed out on " Taylor Hicks and Friends." That's the one thing that turned me off about the show was Simon Cowell passed on this kid because he goes, "Besides which, I hate country. Not my cup of tea.' If I'm judging music, you don't judge the genre. Sorry. Don't be sorry about that Steve! So far, the judges( and I) are smitten with a Josh Turner sound-alike in 16-year-old Scotty McCreery , who made the cut in Milwaukee. Thursday night"s auditions

Barack Obama Kirsten Gillibrand told US television on Sunday she had visited Gabrielle Giffords the previous day and found her "doing great" and "making progress every day." Gabrielle Giffords is using both sides of her body. She's able to breathe on her own. She's able to open her eyes and to show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing, Kirsten Gillibrand told NBC's Meet The Press program. "It's an extraordinary amount of progress for a woman who sustained such a horrific injury," she said. Another congressional colleague, US
